verse: This is what the Lord said to me: “Go and stand at the People’s Gate [of Jerusalem], where the kings of Judah go in and out. And then go to all the other gates of Jerusalem.
Say to them there: ‘Hear the word of the Lord, kings of Judah, all you people of Judah, and all who live in Jerusalem, who come through these gates into the city.
This is what the Lord says: Be careful not to ·carry [lift] a ·load [burden] on the Sabbath day or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem.

Don’t take a ·load [burden] out of your houses on the Sabbath or do any work on that day. But keep the Sabbath as a holy day, as I commanded your ·ancestors [fathers; Ex. 20:8–11; 31:12–18; Deut. 5:12–15].

But your ·ancestors [fathers] did not listen or ·pay attention [incline their ear] to me. They ·were very stubborn [stiffened their necks] and did not listen. ·I punished them, but it didn’t do any good [They did not take instruction/discipline].

But you must ·be careful to obey [listen to] me, says the Lord. You must not bring a ·load [burden] through the gates of this city [Jerusalem] on the Sabbath, but you must keep the Sabbath as a holy day and not do any work on that day.

“‘If you obey this command, kings who sit on David’s throne [2 Sam. 7:11–16] will come through the gates of ·Jerusalem [this city] with their officers. They will come riding in chariots and on horses, along with the people of Judah and Jerusalem. And ·the city of Jerusalem [this city] will have people living in it forever.

People will come [to Jerusalem] from the villages around it, from the towns of Judah, from the land of Benjamin, from the ·western hills [Shephelah], from the mountains, and from ·southern Judah [the Negev]. They will all bring to the ·Temple [house] of the Lord burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17], sacrifices, ·grain [gift; tribute] offerings [Lev. 2:1], incense, and ·offerings to show thanks to God [thank offerings].

But you must obey me and keep the Sabbath day as a holy day. You must not carry any loads into Jerusalem on the Sabbath. If you don’t ·obey [listen to] me, to keep the Sabbath day as a holy day, I will ·start [kindle] a fire at its gates [of Jerusalem], and it will ·burn until it burns even [consume; devour] the ·strong towers [palaces]. And it will not be put out.’”
